item.title: Statistical Inference, Bias, and the Scottish Referendum
item.description: I’ll start this post off by first saying I’m a foreign national living and working in London for a few years. I have no stake in whether or not Scotland votes “yay” or “nay” in the upcoming independence referendum. I’ve been to Scotland a few times, and it’s a lovely place. Whether or not it makes political, economic, or any other form of sense to break up a union lasting a few hundred years?
